question_data.question:
Which of the following is the primary purpose of the `tools` parameter within an OpenAI Agent's configuration?

a) To specify the programming language the agent will use.
b) To define the environment in which the agent will operate.
c) To provide the agent with access to specific functions or APIs it can use to interact with the outside world.
d) To control the agent's personality and communication style.

Which of the following is the primary purpose of the `tools` argument in the `Agent` constructor within the OpenAI Agents SDK?

a) To define the agent's personality and conversational style.
b) To specify the Python interpreter used by the agent.
c) To provide the agent with access to functions and capabilities beyond basic language modeling.
d) To control the agent's memory and information retrieval capabilities.

Which of the following methods is commonly used in the OpenAI Agents SDK to add a tool to an agent?

(a) `agent.add_tool(tool_function)`
(b) `agent.tools.append(tool_function)`
(c) `agent.bind_tools([tool_function])`
(d) `agent.include_tool(tool_function)`

Which of the following is the correct way to initialize a `Tool` object in the OpenAI Agents SDK?

a) `Tool(name="my_tool", func=my_function, description="A tool to do something.")`
b) `Tool("my_tool", my_function, "A tool to do something.")`
c) `Tool.create(name="my_tool", func=my_function, description="A tool to do something.")`
d) `Tool = {"name": "my_tool", "func": my_function, "description": "A tool to do something."}`

Which of the following is the correct way to define a tool in an OpenAI Agent that allows the agent to get the current date?

a) `tools = [Tool(name="get_date", func=datetime.now, description="Gets the current date")]`
b) `tools = [Tool(name="get_date", func=lambda: datetime.now(), description="Gets the current date")]`
c) `tools = [Tool(name="get_date", func=datetime.datetime.now, description="Gets the current date")]`
d) `tools = [Tool(name="get_date", func=str(datetime.datetime.now()), description="Gets the current date")]`
e) None of the above.

Which of the following is the correct way to use the `Agent` class from the OpenAI Agents SDK to create an agent with a specific tool?

a) `agent = Agent(llm=my_llm, tools=[my_tool])`
b) `agent = Agent.create(llm=my_llm, tool=my_tool)`
c) `agent = Agent(model=my_llm, toolkit=my_tool)`
d) `agent = create_agent(llm=my_llm, tools=my_tool)`
